title: Dancing On Ice: H from Steps falls in rehearsal dancing to Tragedy
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

As if we didn’t love him enough, H from Steps has shared another behind the scenes video of him rehearsing for the upcoming series of Dancing On Ice – but it’s not all smooth sailing.

Ian ‘H’ Watkins shared a clip to his Twitter account of him doing the dance moves to Tragedy while trying to rehearse for the show – although he falls over a lot in the process.

In the video the former singer can be seen doing the dance moves to Tragedy, which was one of Steps’ biggest hits (and yes we were doing the dance moves while writing this).

H couldn’t stop falling over but he had a great time doing it as he couldn’t stop laughing (Picture: Ian H Watkins Twitter)

Even though there’s no music playing, you can’t help but laugh along with the star as he continues to fall over while attempting to do some knee slides along the ice.

The star keeps practicing while giggling to himself as he slides (not so gracefully) until the end when he successfully manages to ace the move, finishing with a twirl.

Professional skater Matt Evers has paired up with H ahead of the ITV competition returning in January, as the first same-sex couple, and today the singer shared a behind-the-scenes look to Twitter.

You just can’t help but laugh along with him (Picture: @ianhwatkins)

Provider: @ianhwatkins

‘Totally overwhelmed today… I’ll need some time to just take it all in!!’ H wrote to his Instagram followers alongside a selfie.

‘I’m just totally blown away by your incredible support and messages! Thank you so much, truly xx.’

H has also made show history as the first contestant to be paired up in a same-sex dance couple – beating rival show Strictly Come Dancing.

H from Steps had fun while rehearsing for DOI (Picture: @ianhwatkins)

A source told Metro.co.uk last night that H had asked Dancing On Ice bosses whether he could be matched with a professional of the same gender.

‘After conversations with the Dancing on Ice production team, H enquired as to the possibility of being paired with a male pro skater,’ they said.

The insider continued: ‘Dancing on Ice were fully supportive of a same-sex partnership and as such this year H will be paired with Matt Evers.’

Although he kept falling over…(Picture: @ianhwatkins)

During the 2018 series, former judge Jason Gardiner backed the call for same-sex couples to join the rink.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’m sure ITV would have no problem with embracing it,’ he said. ‘It would be great to have a same-sex couple.’

However, the panelist, who has now been replaced by John Barrowman, was quick to add that those in a same-sex partnership may have their work cut out for them.

Jason explained: ‘When you’ve got two men, generally you’ve got similar heights and weights.

‘That’s when it starts getting difficult. It’s very difficult to put somebody your own size above your head.’

The upcoming 2020 series of Dancing On Ice will see the return of Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean and Ashley Banjo to the panel, and This Morning duo Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby as hosts.

The star-studded line-up was confirmed earlier this month, with the likes of Caprice Bourret and Trisha Goddard donning their skates.

Dancing On Ice returns to ITV in January 2020.
